thread.title: Oklahoma football: Sooners dominate Kansas State Wildcats in Manhattan
thread.title_full: Oklahoma football: Sooners dominate Kansas State Wildcats in Manhattan

author: brady.vardeman@gmail.com(BradyVardeman)
title: Oklahoma football: Sooners dominate Kansas State Wildcats in Manhattan
text:
by Brady Vardeman 
MANHATTAN, Kansas â€” Oklahoma defeated Kansas State 55-0 Saturday while Baker Mayfield threw for five touchdowns in the first half. 
The Sooners got things going just 1:04 into the game, completing a 75-yard drive with a 22-yard strike from Mayfield to Sterling Shepard, his first of two touchdowns of the half. 
With 20 touchdowns in his career, the senior is now just one score away from tying Malcolm Kelly for No. 5 overall in Oklahoma history. 
Running back Joe Mixon added a reception touchdown of his own, a 10-yarder with 8:33 left in the first quarter after a Jordan Thomas interception. 
OU added seven more points after a 28-yard Mayfield scramble and a three-yard touchdown pass to Mark Andrews two plays later. 
Mayfield continued his video game-like first half with his fifth passing touchdown to Dede Westbrook with 4:59 remaining, putting OU up 35-0. 
Just 22 seconds into the second half, Zack Sanchez returned an interception for a touchdown for the third time in his career. He did it for the first time at Kansas State in 2013, which was the first pick of his career. 
Austin Seibert added two third quarter field goals before Joe Mixon picked up his second score of the day and first on the ground to make it a 55-0 OU lead. Highlights
